Posts.Content: Hello new to this forum so bare wth me... I was diagnosed with b/c at aged 28, 5yrs ago now, underwent mastectomy, chemo, radio etc.... comenced tamoxifen plus Zoladex as adjuvant treatment, 2yrs spent off treatment when we concieved our little baby girl, whom is now 8mths of age. Shortly after the birth our baby girl i recomenced the Tamoxifen and Zoladex adjuvant treatment. Recently my oncologist has put to me the option of having my ovaries removed instead of taking Zoladex implants montly. Is there anyone on this forum that has had an ovarian oblation and if so how did it go? Did you still have bleeding afterwards? Were the hot flushes extreme? I am suffering with Depression atm and finding it hard to make the decision, i know that the positives outway the negatives and if i didnt have my little baby i wouldnt even contemplate it, but want to be here for a long time not a short time. Any help advice would be much apreciated Kim
Posts.Signature: Stage 3 breast cancer 2002 @ age 28 R Mastectomy 9/12 Lymph nodes positive Estrogen rec positive, Chemo 3mths AC 3mths Taxotere Radiation daily for 6weeks. Zoladex 3.6mg and Tamoxifen. Oorphorectomy Nov 08, now on Arimidex
Posts.Title: New to Forum Help plz re Zoladex vs Ovarian Oblation

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by mum2chloe Hello new to this forum so bare wth me... I was diagnosed with b/c at aged 28, 5yrs ago now, underwent mastectomy, chemo, radio etc.... comenced tamoxifen plus Zoladex as adjuvant treatment, 2yrs spent off treatment when we concieved our little baby girl, whom is now 8mths of age. Shortly after the birth our baby girl i recomenced the Tamoxifen and Zoladex adjuvant treatment. Recently my oncologist has put to me the option of having my ovaries removed instead of taking Zoladex implants montly. Is there anyone on this forum that has had an ovarian oblation and if so how did it go? Did you still have bleeding afterwards? Were the hot flushes extreme? I am suffering with Depression atm and finding it hard to make the decision, i know that the positives outway the negatives and if i didnt have my little baby i wouldnt even contemplate it, but want to be here for a long time not a short time. Any help advice would be much apreciated Kim Sorry left out some information.... Diagnosed Stage 3 breast cancer 2002 Originally had lumpectomy, margins not clear, underwent a R Mastectomy 1week later. 9/12 Lymph nodes came back positive Estrogen rec positive, pre menopausal Chemotherapy 3mths AC 3mths Taxotere Radiation Treatment daily for 6weeks. Currently having adjuvant treament, Zoladex 3.6mg and Tamoxifen. I am now 34yrs of age and remain cancer free

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by petey Hi! My name is Megan and I have recently been diagnosed with breast cancer. I am 23 years old and am wondering if there is anyone else out there around my age. I would really like to talk with someone close to my age about their experience with cancer. Thanks!!!! Hi Megan, I have not posted on here for a long time, but just briefly logged on to have a read of some posts. I was 28 when dx with stage 3 breast cancer. If you would like to email me i am more than happy to answer any questions. email to [emailÂ protected] hope your well look forward to chatting to you some more. Kim
